net.nprod.rdf4k

Class QueryKt

  • net.nprod.rdf4k.QueryKt

  • public class QueryKt

    • Method Detail

      • selectQuery

        @NotNull
public static org.eclipse.rdf4j.sparqlbuilder.core.query.SelectQuery selectQuery(@NotNull
                                                                                          kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super org.eclipse.rdf4j.sparqlbuilder.core.query.SelectQuery,kotlin.Unit> block)

        Allows to construct a SPARQL Query using Kotlin's DSL

        /**
 * RDF Tutorial example K02: Using the Query Builder as a DSL
 *
 * Refer to that documentation: [http://docs.rdf4j.org/sparqlbuilder/]
 *
 *
 * @author Jonathan Bisson
 */
object ExampleK02QueryBuilder {

    @JvmStatic
    fun main(args: Array) {


        // We are using the adapted Kotlin DSL here
        val model = modelBuilder {
            namespace("ex", "http://example.org/")
            subject("ex:a") {
                add(FOAF.NAME, "Katherine Johnson")
                add(RDF.TYPE, FOAF.PERSON)
            }
            subject("ex:b") {
                add(FOAF.NAME, "Grace Hopper")
                add(RDF.TYPE, FOAF.PERSON)
            }
        }.build()

        val foafPrefix = sparqlPrefix("foaf", iri(FOAF.NAMESPACE))

        val name = sparqlVariable("name")
        val x = sparqlVariable("x")
        val selectQuery = (selectQuery {
            prefix(foafPrefix)
            // Could also have used directly
            // prefix("foaf", iri("http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/"))
            select(name) {
                where(
                        x.has(foafPrefix.iri("name"), name),
                        x.isA(foafPrefix.iri("Person"))
                )
            }
        } orderBy name limit 5 offset 0 ).queryString
        println(selectQuery)
        val db = SailRepository(MemoryStore())
        db.init()
        // Open a connection to the database
        try {
            db.connection.apply {
                // add the model
                add(model)
                val query = prepareTupleQuery(selectQuery)
                query.evaluate().map {
                    // ... and print out the value of the variable binding for ?name
                    println("name = ${it["name"]}")
                }
            }
        } finally {
            // before our program exits, make sure the database is properly shut down.
            db.shutDown()
        }
    }
}

      • select

        @NotNull
public static org.eclipse.rdf4j.sparqlbuilder.core.query.SelectQuery select(@NotNull
                                                                                     org.eclipse.rdf4j.sparqlbuilder.core.query.SelectQuery $receiver,
                                                                                     @Nullable
                                                                                     org.eclipse.rdf4j.sparqlbuilder.core.Variable name,

        Allows to insert a select in a SPARQL Query using Kotlin's DSL

        /**
 * RDF Tutorial example K02: Using the Query Builder as a DSL
 *
 * Refer to that documentation: [http://docs.rdf4j.org/sparqlbuilder/]
 *
 *
 * @author Jonathan Bisson
 */
object ExampleK02QueryBuilder {

    @JvmStatic
    fun main(args: Array) {


        // We are using the adapted Kotlin DSL here
        val model = modelBuilder {
            namespace("ex", "http://example.org/")
            subject("ex:a") {
                add(FOAF.NAME, "Katherine Johnson")
                add(RDF.TYPE, FOAF.PERSON)
            }
            subject("ex:b") {
                add(FOAF.NAME, "Grace Hopper")
                add(RDF.TYPE, FOAF.PERSON)
            }
        }.build()

        val foafPrefix = sparqlPrefix("foaf", iri(FOAF.NAMESPACE))

        val name = sparqlVariable("name")
        val x = sparqlVariable("x")
        val selectQuery = (selectQuery {
            prefix(foafPrefix)
            // Could also have used directly
            // prefix("foaf", iri("http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/"))
            select(name) {
                where(
                        x.has(foafPrefix.iri("name"), name),
                        x.isA(foafPrefix.iri("Person"))
                )
            }
        } orderBy name limit 5 offset 0 ).queryString
        println(selectQuery)
        val db = SailRepository(MemoryStore())
        db.init()
        // Open a connection to the database
        try {
            db.connection.apply {
                // add the model
                add(model)
                val query = prepareTupleQuery(selectQuery)
                query.evaluate().map {
                    // ... and print out the value of the variable binding for ?name
                    println("name = ${it["name"]}")
                }
            }
        } finally {
            // before our program exits, make sure the database is properly shut down.
            db.shutDown()
        }
    }
}

      • prefix

        Allows to insert a prefix in a SPARQL Query using Kotlin's DSL

        /**
 * RDF Tutorial example K02: Using the Query Builder as a DSL
 *
 * Refer to that documentation: [http://docs.rdf4j.org/sparqlbuilder/]
 *
 *
 * @author Jonathan Bisson
 */

    @JvmStatic
    fun main(args: Array) {


        // We are using the adapted Kotlin DSL here
        val model = modelBuilder {
            namespace("ex", "http://example.org/")
            subject("ex:a") {
                add(FOAF.NAME, "Katherine Johnson")
                add(RDF.TYPE, FOAF.PERSON)
            }
            subject("ex:b") {
                add(FOAF.NAME, "Grace Hopper")
                add(RDF.TYPE, FOAF.PERSON)
            }
        }.build()

        val foafPrefix = sparqlPrefix("foaf", iri(FOAF.NAMESPACE))

        val name = sparqlVariable("name")
        val x = sparqlVariable("x")

            prefix(foafPrefix)
            // Could also have used directly
            // prefix("foaf", iri("http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/"))

                where(
                        x.has(foafPrefix.iri("name"), name),
                        x.isA(foafPrefix.iri("Person"))
                )
            }

        println(selectQuery)
        val db = SailRepository(MemoryStore())
        db.init()

            db.connection.apply {

                add(model)

                    // ... and print out the value of the variable binding for ?name
                    println("name = ${it["name"]}")
                }
            }
        } finally {
            // before our program exits, make sure the database is properly shut down.
            db.shutDown()
        }
    }
}

      • sparqlVariable

        @NotNull
public static org.eclipse.rdf4j.sparqlbuilder.core.Variable sparqlVariable(@NotNull
                                                                                    java.lang.String name)

        A helper function to help write SPARQL variables in the DSL

        /**
 * RDF Tutorial example K02: Using the Query Builder as a DSL
 *
 * Refer to that documentation: [http://docs.rdf4j.org/sparqlbuilder/]
 *
 *
 * @author Jonathan Bisson
 */
object ExampleK02QueryBuilder {

    @JvmStatic
    fun main(args: Array) {


        // We are using the adapted Kotlin DSL here
        val model = modelBuilder {
            namespace("ex", "http://example.org/")
            subject("ex:a") {
                add(FOAF.NAME, "Katherine Johnson")
                add(RDF.TYPE, FOAF.PERSON)
            }
            subject("ex:b") {
                add(FOAF.NAME, "Grace Hopper")
                add(RDF.TYPE, FOAF.PERSON)
            }
        }.build()

        val foafPrefix = sparqlPrefix("foaf", iri(FOAF.NAMESPACE))

        val name = sparqlVariable("name")
        val x = sparqlVariable("x")
        val selectQuery = (selectQuery {
            prefix(foafPrefix)
            // Could also have used directly
            // prefix("foaf", iri("http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/"))
            select(name) {
                where(
                        x.has(foafPrefix.iri("name"), name),
                        x.isA(foafPrefix.iri("Person"))
                )
            }
        } orderBy name limit 5 offset 0 ).queryString
        println(selectQuery)
        val db = SailRepository(MemoryStore())
        db.init()
        // Open a connection to the database
        try {
            db.connection.apply {
                // add the model
                add(model)
                val query = prepareTupleQuery(selectQuery)
                query.evaluate().map {
                    // ... and print out the value of the variable binding for ?name
                    println("name = ${it["name"]}")
                }
            }
        } finally {
            // before our program exits, make sure the database is properly shut down.
            db.shutDown()
        }
    }
}

        A helper function to help write SPARQL prefix in the DSL

        /**
 * RDF Tutorial example K02: Using the Query Builder as a DSL
 *
 * Refer to that documentation: [http://docs.rdf4j.org/sparqlbuilder/]
 *

    @JvmStatic

            namespace("ex", "http://example.org/")
